question: Identify the option showing the correct labelling for p, q, r and s with reference to the conducting system of the human heart.
images/2023-bio-55-1.png
choices: p-Bundle of His, q-SAN, r-Interventricular septum, s-AVN
p-SAN, q-AVN, r-Bundle of His, s-Interventricular septum
p-Interventricular septum, q-AVN, r-Bundle of His, s-SAN
p-AVN, q-SAN, r-Interventricular septum, s-Bundle of His
explanation: In the standard diagram of the heart's conducting system: 'p' (upper right atrium) is the Sino-atrial Node (SAN), 'q' (lower left of right atrium) is the Atrio-ventricular Node (AVN), 'r' represents the Bundle of His arising from AVN, and 's' points towards the interventricular septum/bundle branches.
